website_summaries.verdict: A strong, well-designed stand that's both functional and aesthetically pleasing.
pros: Made from sturdy aluminum with a non-slip rubber bottom
We loved the customizable light and color settings
The software was quick and simple to install
2 additional USB ports are included in the base
The 6-foot power cord provides multiple placement options
cons: The USB ports charge devices on the slower side

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This headset stand has issues all of it's own, ranging from the built in sound card to the Corsair iCue Software not syncing or seeing the device. Corsair has been contacted regarding the matter, and yet fails to support this product. Furthermore, the product is no longer offered on their site. The internal components of this stand will cause conflicts with anyone using a wireless headset other than a Corsair brand. Issues have been documented regarding using the Logitech G933 Artimus Spectrum headsets with this product. Extremely poor customer support for this product by Corsair. Better off to purchase a regular stand, and the RGB Lighting is not very bright or impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Henry J Anderson II

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoyed, but did not last
customer_reviews.text: So i bought this product a few months ago from writing this review, i at first i loved it. I loved the Led lights and the way it synced to my other corsair products. i unplugged it one time to clean my pc, and now it seems to disconnect at the slightest movement of the stand. Id expect something like this to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: LRM

customer_reviews.title: Corsair for the Win Again
customer_reviews.text: Well I love Corsair products as they have never let me down and this headphone stand is no exception to that matter. Great build quality metal frame and software is easy to use.. I have no issues with literally any Corsair products this is just an extra addition and holds my Void Pro Wireless headphones like they were meant to be there.. Thanks Corsair always giving the gaming community high quality performing products.
customer_reviews.author: JayLivion32

customer_reviews.title: The USB-C port on the back died on me within about 7 weeks of owning it.
customer_reviews.text: The USB-C port on the back died on me within about 7 weeks of owning it. Doing an RMA with Corsair, the numbers aren't very friendly. You have to pay for your own shipping to return it to them, which was $25 -- one third the cost of a replacement. Plus the long wait. It looks cool and its fun to mess with the RGB settings in iQue, but I'll probably list my replacement on Craigslist just so that I don't have to worry about another one dying on me and wasting money on a 2nd RMA. The rest of my Corsair components were nice but this one felt CHEAP.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

customer_reviews.title: ST100 has let me down
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the fact that it has the rgb and and it can hold my corsairs head set and it has two more usbs for my tower is always beneficial. But after about a moth of use the cord started to come loose and i have to have it a certain way and it will lose connection and will disconnect completely and need to be moved to reconnected. I have come to the point that i have disconnected it and jut use it as a stand. ver disappointed in the product
customer_reviews.author: Bricetafer

customer_reviews.title: It will damage your headset
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to complete my collection with this stand. I have the Corsair K70, Scimitar and Polaris. I bought this with the Void pro. My god such a mistake.. 1. Its created in the headset cushion. My headset is now permanently damaged from it. 2. The lighting on it is dim and not color sync compared to its counterparts. I am suuuper disappointed in this design flaw. Do not buy this unless you have a hard brace like a Razer Kraken Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Ark

customer_reviews.title: the corsair iCUE Software causes system preference issues.
customer_reviews.text: the corsair iCUE Software causes system preference issues. i have submitted numerous technical support cases to corsair about who was soon as their ICUE software is installed my internet speed drops form 900 to 200 mbps with no response. iCUE Software is poorly witten, UI is not friendly and it is a strain on system resources, AVOID corsair "iCUE enabled" products.
customer_reviews.author: koman90

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphone stand! Reference Pics for SHP9500 & HD58X
customer_reviews.text: The aluminum is extremely sturdy and RGB works perfectly with iCue and other Corsair products. It has two additional USB 3.1 passthrough and an audio jack that supports 7.1 surround sound. Although I won't be using that feature, it is nice to have for someone who doesn't want to plug their headphones into the back of the PC. For reference, my Philips SHP9500 fit perfectly on the stand, but it's just a bit too wide for my Sennheiser HD58X, even with it's recessed groove in the headband cushion for headstand compatibility. If the corsair stand could've been rounded to match the arc of headphone head bands, it would be perfect. Other than that, its great.
customer_reviews.author: Junstar

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, if you care.
customer_reviews.text: Is this obnoxiously overpriced? Yes. Am I an idiot for buying this? Yes. Does it feel premium? Quite so. This stand has got to be one of the dumbest purchases I've ever made. But it does it's job. So there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Jones

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this stand for the looks and the sound quality ...
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this stand for the looks and the sound quality of the 7.1 surround chip installed in it. Marvelous!!! 😁 😁 😁 they accept other brands of headphones as well. There is two USB ports as well for a wireless adaptor or cell phone charging. The charger is slow but it's there. Over all I'm really happy with the purchase. I also bought the void pro wireless headphones which was a great upgrade coming from a 5.1 audio card and older gaming headphones. I would recommend definatly if your looking to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: eugene

customer_reviews.title: Great colors, even better spare USB ports
customer_reviews.text: IF you are looking to RGB your setup then this is a nice addition, IF you are on the fence, then this may put you over as it has 2 additional USB ports as well as 7.1 audio codec inside I have many headsets, but its nice to put the flavor of the day out on display, this stand is beautiful and hits all the positives for me in the fact that it has 2 additional usb ports (the top one is not good for hard drives though as my drive kept stopping and spinning up again, the side ports work just fine) The audio cable was hooked up to my razer nommo (sp?) speakers and sound great, would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jurado

customer_reviews.title: You might actually need this.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality. It looks sleek and beautiful. Nice heavy metal weight to it so it doesn't slide around. The USB ports are useful for charging wireless headphones or to use as a hub. The LEDs look nice, but admittedly I don't care about the LEDs, and never even configured them. I didn't know I needed one of these until I got one. I have to admit that I had fully intended to try this for a few days and then return it. After seeing how useful it was by being able to hang my headphones on the hook instead of leaving them on my already cluttery desk, sold me on it. 100% worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Total Legend

customer_reviews.title: This stand has its potential to be worth for its price, but Corsair messed up it up
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I would like to say the build of this stand is top notch. I have been using many headstands in the market, but this is the most sturdiest one. Down side is it is lower than other ones a bit. Biggest issue of this stand is it keeps getting disconnected while being used which gets very annoyed while I am connect my wired headset to it or connect my dongle to it for my wireless headset. Corsair has been really quiet about this well-known issues for this, but they have really not released any firmware to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Van

customer_reviews.title: I actually really like it BUT if you have any type of audiophile ...
customer_reviews.text: So, I actually really like it BUT if you have any type of audiophile headphones with big ears they do not fit on this stand. Unless you have them stretch over the support beam. The beam that comes out that you rest your headphones/headset on is not long enough so the ear pads hit the vertical beam. Headsets should be fine. I gave four stars because its "nicely" made but wish Corsair would of thought about bigger headphones. I will more than likely return and continue using my SilverStone which is massive.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Complete and utter rubbish.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great initially. I was really excited but over the last month the battery completely dies after about 3 hours of use. I turned off the lighting effects and it makes no difference. What huge disappointment...I buy a lot on Amazon but what I won't be buying again are Corsair products. Shame to, it is a nice headset but now after a month or so it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rossko

customer_reviews.title: LED's default to rainbow fade when computer sleeps
customer_reviews.text: Turns out the ST100 itself has no built in memory, so the only time a custom lighting config works is when connected to iCue software and the software is running. Otherwise it's rainbow fade all day every day. Any time I put my computer to sleep or log off current user, the lights automatically jump into the rainbow fade default. Checked with Corsair support, there is no way to change this. Looks nice, but not having the ability to turn off the LED's when your computer sleeps (without USB power management or physically unplugging the device) is a deal breaker. Returning for something that will actually sleep properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: Love how the stand has 2 USB ports, one well positioned for the wireless receiver and the other works well when a charge is needed on the headset or any other device. Haven't tried the 3.5mm jack, as I don't see a reason for it with the headset. Maybe I could use it to plug in my tabletop speakers. I think I will give this a try and reduced cable clutter and see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Bad follow through.
customer_reviews.text: Corsair should be ashamed of themselves for this product. It’s expensive and barely works like it’s supposed to. Half the time it’s in demo mode even though I’ve swapped it through most of my USB 3.0 ports. They usually make such good equipment. It’s sad they fall short on things like this. It’s very well made and will probably last a long time. Hopefully Corsair will follow through with support for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Forkash

customer_reviews.title: Uses 40 to 50 percent of the computer CPU
customer_reviews.text: BIG PROBLEM! The ICue software that controls the lighting takes up a constant 40-50 percent of the computer CPU. There is no reason for this, and it looks like its a problem for many others on-line. Without the software, there is no way to control the light pattern or brightness. It just stays on the rotating rainbow pattern and is very bright/distracting. Would have been exceptional except for this major software flaw. I have removed the software and will be returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: L. Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Annoying issues, overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good looking stand, you know that before you buy it. Programming the lights is very unintuitive, really no idea what they were thinking with that aweful program. I'd raise the rating if they improved the programming so it was even moderately tollerable, considering the cost the lights should be manigable. When I plug in my corsair headset when it's low on batteries it beeps nonstop, plug it into my computer and it's fine. If you don't want to program the lights or charge your headset with this I'm sure you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: High quality construction but USB slot doesn't get recognized by Corsair Wireless Headset Dongle
customer_reviews.text: It's advertised as being able to pluf the Corsair wireless headset dongle into the usb port on the product but my headset is not recognized when using that port. Have tried every form of driver updates, mobo driver updates and BIOS updates, and still couldn't get my computer to detect my headset. The lighting is cool, and the stand is made from heavy, beautifully finished metal. if the USB port could be used for hardware you computer needs to detect it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: A Green Bean

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it's just okay
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this for his hard core gaming system. He liked it at first and the overall quality seemed pretty good, but the software that is used by the stand must be downloaded, and it isn't the best. It interfered with his Windows 10 system and caused sound cut outs and other odd glitches. It is basically a simple and colorful headset stand now, minus the software. I would not buy this again unless the software was upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for my super nerdy gaming son. He LOVES it. That said, I was pleasantly surprised by the fact that the headset is made of a nice heavy metal, not the standard plastic that most are made of these days. The RGB color is vibrant. You will need to purchase a cable separately to connect your headset to the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality terrible software
customer_reviews.text: The materials used for this feel great but same issue with the headset from corsair..... Software is garbage. You can't have great hardware then throw it all away with having terrible software. Of the software and connectivity issues were ever addressed I would change my review. But seeing as this is corsair they don't read comments made on the forums and the software and connectivity will never improve.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected and sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My wired headphones sound great when plugged into it! I also have the void headphones and the surround sound from this works just as well as from the void headphones! It's a bit expensive for what it does and the app doesn't have as many options as my Creative Sound BlasterX G1 app does, but I would not have bought the G1, had I known about the ST100 first. I also had to have this to complete my Corsair RGB lighting set that I already have (keyboard, mouse, void headphones, and mouse pad).
customer_reviews.author: Capt'n Burns

customer_reviews.title: Good pair with Cosair Virtuoso SE
customer_reviews.text: I use along with my Corsair Virtuoso SE. It is a lovely setup. I compared both the sound setting that came with this stand and the Virtuoso SE. It is on all the same settings beside the FPS competition. I like the Virtuoso SE FPS competition setting a little more than this stand's FPS competition.
customer_reviews.author: Vang

customer_reviews.title: Great stand but the cable it uses sucks
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand its really good but what i hate is that corsair chose a horrible usb type b cable and i havent had this for a while but the port or cord is starting to break and it is disconnecting its self alot. Other than that it is a decent stand and i have alot of corsair stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Erik L.

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Heavy Duty Stand... Price a Little High.
customer_reviews.text: Although I really like this stand, I am not sure it's worth the $60 price tag. The lights are really cool to look at, but I could have lived without them for less money. However, it is heavy duty stand with the 2 USB ports, which I use for my transmitter and headphone charging cable, but they work with other USB devices if you so choose. There is an output headphone jack, but I have no use for it since my headphones are wireless. All in all, I recommend it for its high quality.
customer_reviews.author: T Baran

customer_reviews.title: Necessary? No. Cool? Kinda.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my full RGB PC build. The headset stand is extremely sturdy and the RGB features are *decent.* I am just disappointed in how dim the LEDs in this are in comparison to the rest of Corsairs RGB peripherals. Unless you're insisted on having RGB everything I'd pass on this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stylish headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: The stand does a good job and feels sturdy. Looks great as well. The stand could be a bit taller as any headphones that require a usb connection. If you have a usb wireless adapter plugged there, it does not allow enough clearance for the headphones and could end up causing issues down the line with the headphones pushing on the usb adapter when on the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Still not an RGB Fanboy
customer_reviews.text: Always thought a headphone stand would be pointless and RGB would be a waste of money.... But I have got to say that the bukd quality of this stand is pretty great. And it feels like my headphones are getting better sound quality. I really like this stand. The RGB effects are also pretty cool, but I'm not a fanboy yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: Its faulty
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in July, we just took this out of the box and started using this in December, and the cord does not work, so it only lights up when you jiggle it, and that causes the sound to be spotty. Horrible!
customer_reviews.author: GoCoast

customer_reviews.title: Good weight and decent RGB
customer_reviews.text: This stand has a nice weight to it, great USB extensions and headphone plugins. The RGB is decent, would like to see more RGB, but I likes me some RGB so maybe it's OK. plugged in perfectly, Win10 picked it right up. Looks great and feels very solid. iCue works perfect with it.
customer_reviews.author: LordChumley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Addition to my Set Up!
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, from the pictures I saw on here I assumed that it was made of plastic but nope! All metal! I purchased this because I had just replaced my previous headset and wanted a stand for it. I was originally going to purchase the Razor headset stand but I decided to go with Corsair since I purchased a Corsair headset, keyboard and mouse...might as well stay with the same brand right? I love it and It makes a lovely addition to my set up~
customer_reviews.author: SonniiTea

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Touch
customer_reviews.text: Described perfectly and works exactly as you would expect it to. the only thing I wish it had would be a constantly powered small inner compartment with another USB port to manage and hide the charging cable for users who have a wireless headset like me but I’ve found my workaround. Overall a 10/10 product
customer_reviews.author: Chris N

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't sure about spending 60 bucks on something that holds my headphones, but the software and ports that come with this product clear up my wires on my desk so much. I have all of my audio running from this unit (I switch between headphones with an amp, and a Bose speaker setup), with only 1 USB cord actually running to the computer now. Makes things convenient, and looks really cool (which, lets face it, is what drew your attention to this product in the first place).
customer_reviews.author: Nick O

customer_reviews.title: it would be great to see USB C instead of micro USB and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to get this thing for months and finally pulled the trigger. Lovely mount (big Corsair fan so I have a lot of their peripherals and this matches very well). I do wish it had my RGB lighting. Also, for future versions, it would be great to see USB C instead of micro USB and to have the top part wirelessly charge the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: KAREEM

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my gaming son. He has a number of different headphones and after his research he asked for this stand. It seems like he's liked it and whenever I see his headphones not in use, they're on this stand. It seems to be a good value for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Noble

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headset stand, great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! It does not take up too much space, but is a perfect place to keep headphones off the table or hanging off the monitor, to protect them and allows a good place to charge as well. You can tell it is definitely made of quality materials, and was easy to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Zoie Stratiou

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: My grandson researched it and told me what to order, he loves it and uses it continually to rest his headphones. I really don't know why you can't hang them on a nail, but he loves them so I do also.
customer_reviews.author: neonleon

customer_reviews.title: Colors are wrong
customer_reviews.text: The stand itself is very sturdy and feels of high quality, however the RGB colors are very plainly wrong. Attempting to set a pure white gives off a pale blue hue, while yellows and oranges are shifted green. The lights themselves are also not especially bright, especially when compared to a Corsair keyboard. This might not be a problem if you don't plan to set a pure white, but for the cost I expect better. Isn't the RGB the entire point, after all? Returned the product and the replacement I received had the exact same issue.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're willing to waste a bit of money or a want a full CUE setup!
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly overpriced. But if you're looking for a complete corsair (CUE) setup or you have money to blow, it's certainly worth buying At $60 this really needs a couple more usb ports and a microphone jack. At least the build quality is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Christophel

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking, quality stand
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, well built, sturdy stand and charging station for your headphones. USB port extension is a nice touch. Overall happy with this item as it keeps the headphones out of the reach of my dog.
customer_reviews.author: JOHNNYRINGO

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Causes a sound driver crash forcing a full restart to restore sound and at its price point its a waste of money, id return it but it would cost me more for the trip to ups to send it back then its worth. id give it 0 stars if i could
customer_reviews.author: m. chapline

customer_reviews.title: High-quality metal holder for the headset
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphone holder with two built-in usb 3.0 ports and one 3.5 mm headset Jack. The metal base in combination with the rubberized base guarantees long service life, beautiful appearance and stability. I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sober01ShT

customer_reviews.title: Defective Corsair Stand
customer_reviews.text: The defective corsair stand doesnt match up with the rest of my setup (using corsair link) the spiral rainbow, rain, and visor animations lag. Sometimes the stand doesn't even turn on when starting windows . I was excited before, but now I'm just very disappointed.😒😠
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Centeno

customer_reviews.title: only rgb
customer_reviews.text: you can only have the full spectrum of colors. you can't get only one solid color. either color cycle, color shift or rainbow... construction of the device is strong, it will not tip over but the iCUE software is trash.
customer_reviews.author: sarv

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects Randomly
customer_reviews.text: The stand looks and feels great! But unfortunately seems to have an issue where it disconnects randomly without reason and then reconnects a few seconds later. Annoying, but not a deal breaker. The lighting software is rather clunky and breaks easy, but that is something I'm used to having a number of Corsair devices.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Fennig

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphone stand.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. The stand is stable and solid. The rgb lights on the neck of the stand and base are bright, however if you light super bright popping lights you should use the Razer stand. The iCue software works flawlessly and gives you a ton of options for customization of the lights. The 7.1 surround sound feature from the 3.5mm jack is a nice addition as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A nice RGB stand
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty to look at but when paired with the HS60 headset I've had issues getting the headset to fully work. I've since reverted to just using the stand as a stand and connecting the headset to the PC using its included 7.1 usb adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Weavil

customer_reviews.title: Simple headphone stand for Corsair Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Corsair Surround 7.1 headphones and wanted a headphone stand for them and when i seen this headphone stand from Corsair i loved it! However, the steep cost is only justified by its two usb 3.0 ports and a built in 7.1 surround sound card in the headphone jack. However, this is made from black power coated aluminum and it is ICUE software compatable that helped me make my decision vs using a different more cheaper product
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: RGB headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It lights up. It holds your headphones up. It has a USB 3.0 pass through. Oh and its a DAC. This thing is definitely worth the price if you need something that can do all three. I would recommend this over Razer's stand.
customer_reviews.author: S01-X

customer_reviews.title: Durable and handy
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this headset stand I would just toss mine on the desk. This helps to keep the desk a little neater, provides additional usb ports, and helps to protect the headset from accidental damage. Heavy duty metal construction means this thing will last for some time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Schmelzer

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really well constructed and very clean looking. I was really amazed by the quality of this headphone stand. Also I would call it an audio stand headphone stand does it no justice with all the options it has.
customer_reviews.author: Norval

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars Because it works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I want a fancy headphone stand and I got what I expected. Cool extra features, lighting is nice. Nothing much to say really. I don't recommend this of course if you're strict with your budget, but if you're a sad dude like me who finds a little bit of joy when he shops, then, by all means, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Great RGB addition. ALL THE LIGHTS!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice solid build. Great addition to my gaming setup. Haven't tried the audio seeing as how my headset is already 7.1 DTS, but I'm sure if it's sounds are as good as the quality, then it'll be amazing. Love the solid metal feel of it all. Linked great with iCUE and my other Corsair devices.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Minor Issues Imperfections
customer_reviews.text: For some reason doesn’t seem to sit flat has a bit of a wobble the bottom middle seems to have more padding or something that won’t let it sit flat but whatever still highly recommend Corsair the best
customer_reviews.author: Bleach

customer_reviews.title: CORSAIR ST100 RGB Premium Headset Stand
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced? YEP! Does it look cool? YEP! Does it work well? YEP! Holds my headset perfectly. Regrets? NOPE! So, other than the price, I love this item. RGB's are very cool on it. And extra USB ports are handy as well.
customer_reviews.author: NyteHawk

customer_reviews.title: It feels like it's made out of cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Clearly a ridiculous vanity item with necessary function. I guess it makes up for that in form and construction. It feels like it's made out of cast iron, solid as a rock
customer_reviews.author: Benyosef

customer_reviews.title: It completes the set...well played Corsair, well played...
customer_reviews.text: It's a stand. It lights up. It can sync to the lights on all my other geek stuff (Corsair). Headphones fit nicely on it. Probably over-priced but did I mention it has moving lights? Maybe I am, too easily amused but I smile every time I walk into my home office and see the lightshow.
customer_reviews.author: AndyW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This item is very high quality, it’s made out of a tough metal, maybe aluminum maybe steel idk I didn’t read the description I thought it was gonna be plastic, anyways it’s very durable. No need to put it together it comes like that straight out of the box. It was definitely worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: VirtualGamer153

customer_reviews.title: Colorful
customer_reviews.text: I'm not entirely sure how I feel about the sound quality. It is in such a way where I'm not sure what exactly has changed. All the same it is an extra two ports for the price of one and it holds my headset. The customization I can use with icue helps quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: False Path

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stand for my husband for Christmas. He likes it a lot. I didn't rate the sound quality because I don't know how that function is as my husband uses it mainly to hold up his headset. His headset is plugged into his computer.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal S. Podesta

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone Stand
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a headphone stand for a long time and I’m glad I waited. This stand is simply AWESOME! I have all of the Corsair products that connect with their software, the light bar on the stand is in sync with everything. Beautiful, functional and made of quality! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gunny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband for christmas and I kind of want to order it for myself now as well! Works great for setting down the headset and adds some RBG flair.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful, and was worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I read plenty of reviews saying this wasn’t worth $60, and I have to disagree. Although I didn’t have my computer at the time of the recording, I didn’t see any problems with this product at all. The colors seem to pop really well, and the headset stand seems to be made out of a black steel. In the video it’s holding up my Astro A40’s, and they aren’t exactly a light headset. Sorry, for my friend raging in the background 😂
customer_reviews.author: trenten thompson

customer_reviews.title: Matches my setup perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works with the Corsair CUE software, so the RGB lights match the rest of my peripherals. It is pretty heavy, so just bumping it isn't going to knock it over. It is pretty pricey for a headset stand, though.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great product, OK software.
customer_reviews.text: Love the stand, amazing quality aluminum. Very sturdy, doesn't slide around on my glass desk. CUE software is currently unstable so right now I cannot use it properly. Another friend is having issues with it doing the same. So its a user to user basis I would assume. Worth the money to have a nice stand that also has (2) USB plug ins.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work that well except for holding the headset, dosen't charge well after the first couple of times
customer_reviews.text: Charging station stops working randomly and we have to use another charger instead of this have the time because of the issues with this charging station. The head set had it's own problems the the mic, refer to my review on that for other details.
customer_reviews.author: E.A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, mediocre software
customer_reviews.text: I spent a long time thinking the LEDs on this thing had died in under a year. Turns out the ICUE software was just spazing out and presumably an update fixed it. Wouldn't be the first time. But now it seems to work great, and of course the main function of the product was always great.
customer_reviews.author: A. A. Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love this stand. Super useful! Easy enough to program the lighting through iCue for this product. Overpriced but that's a Corsair thing.
customer_reviews.author: Team Howard

customer_reviews.title: Nice RGB
customer_reviews.text: It's great to have a stand for my headphones and the extra USB port is nice, too. I like the RGB aspect as well.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Bond

customer_reviews.title: Nice system
customer_reviews.text: Great system works with the mousepad, keyboard, and mouse. Great for gaming and looks cool. My son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: seguinw

customer_reviews.title: Super Sturdy and Super Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: If you read any other of my reviews on Corsair Products, you know I love RGB, and this does not disappoint. It has two RGB zones, One at the bottom, and One at just higher than the middle showing the Corsair Logo in it's full glory. It is made out of what I can tell, metal, so It's very durable. Other than placing a headset on there it has no use what so ever and at 59$ It is very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: David Da

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised when unboxing this.
customer_reviews.text: When i got this and was unboxing it, i was thinking this would be plastic and light weight. When i took it out of the box it was heavy and you can feel the construction is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Sandeep Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations. Great product
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this to hang my corsair void rgb headphones and match my mousepad. I had no idea it turned any headphones with a standard 3.5mm Jack into 7.1 surround headphones. Above and beyond corsair. You keep doing you !
customer_reviews.author: Jason Denwalt

customer_reviews.title: Cool and classy
customer_reviews.text: I got this just because I could - I admit it. It's cool and well built and will last from now on for me.
customer_reviews.author: jpooch00

customer_reviews.title: I love this headset stand!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got a great price on Prime day. Built like a tank, very sturdy and great build quality. Looks great and is a great way to show off your headset. It's pricey but you get what you pay for. And of course the RGB is terrific especially with other Corsair products.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Anderson

customer_reviews.title: These are not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Before you make this expensive purchase think to yourself do I really need these. These are 60 bucks I would recommend if you have extra money laying around and you want to spoil yourself or someone else. There are two usb ports and the middle one does not work when I plug my adapter for my wireless headphones that was the biggest bummer but other than that It is just a stand that lights up.
customer_reviews.author: Ibram

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tho, but definitely not necessary ..
customer_reviews.text: Total Geekness, - Love it, solid weight.. Pass throught 3.0 is helpful.. but as a design improvement.. they should put multiple USB slots and (C) on the neck of the stand. Awesome tho, but definitely not necessary ..
customer_reviews.author: dennisshopping

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well, Problems after few months
customer_reviews.text: Along with many of the negative reviews, the ST100 has usb/wiring/lighting issues after few months. Now it's only used as a headset stand as the data/usb doesn't work on it. Check threads on reddit as this is an occuring issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Noblesala

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: the usb ports are very useful especially for charging wireless headsets. I don't use the sound plugins but other than that it has a good weight to it and the lights are the perfect amount of brightness. I would definitely recommend if you're an rgb fan and if you have a wireless headset, it's a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Gu

customer_reviews.title: Better than a banana stand
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just awesome. I bought it along with the Corsair Void Pro 10 months ago. The RGB is very bright and easy to customize in Corsair's software (iCUE). I recently bought a Corsair mouse as well, and having all 3 products sync RGB waves is just amazing. Build quality is awesome. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mika Garnett

customer_reviews.title: TTV/nerdynergy
customer_reviews.text: The USB 3.0 is strong enough to run my vr headset which is impressive considering lol. This is amazing. Sturdy and everything!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetic look but needs brighter LEDs
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great headset stand if you're looking for something aesthetic to add to your room. Sleek design with aesthetic LEDs. Sturdy enough to hold heavy headsets. Not too tall and not too short, can hold many types of headsets. 2 USB ports make it easy for wireless headset charging and phone charging. LEDs are a bit dimmer than I expected. Would recommend to buy as a headset stand if LEDs brightness is not that important.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Liu

customer_reviews.title: It's a RGB headset stand, what else could you ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a RGB headset stand, what else could you review about it. If you're into RGB, it's appealing. The extra USB slots is what made me buy it because my computer has only 2 USB port in the front for my headset/external drive. Wanted an extra USB port near me.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Chao

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Simple to setup, simple to use, customizable in iCue, looks fantastic and very classy looking
customer_reviews.author: Marlo M

customer_reviews.title: RGB's
customer_reviews.text: Great well made I was a little disappointed by the RGB's not being as bright as I thought they would be. Again the Corsair software is a little buggy my stand didn't show up in the corsair utility until i unplugged it and reconnect
customer_reviews.author: Don Trail

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of other Corsair products... this fits in well on my desk. Its metal construction and the RGB is just enough, not to over the top bright
customer_reviews.author: ryan monaghan

customer_reviews.title: Does it look cool? You bet your butt it does
customer_reviews.text: I hang my Void Pro on this. Is it functional? Not for me, really. Do you need it? Probably not. Does it look cool? You bet your butt it does! Lights sync up with my headset and my Corsair mouse, which I think is cool. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but I like it
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to get this, but once the pain of spending $60 on a headset stand is over you will not regret it
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: What i expected
customer_reviews.text: Kinda wish the usb would come out of the back and not under where the headset hangs. Other than that I love it. It's a solid stand and the RGB is bright and saturated.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Slim Shady

customer_reviews.title: Functional with Class
customer_reviews.text: This headset stand is very typical of Corsair quality, you might have to pay a little more - but the quality is worth the expense. A very solid unit that graces your desktop with RGB lighting and simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Willilam B.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, high quality
customer_reviews.text: This stand is absolutely beautiful. The materials are of high quality and the glowing color effects are amazing. It is a perfect seat for my Arctis headset!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and solid structure. No complaints here especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: High quality product you can expect from corsair. Hold my headset and looks good doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Hunk of metal holding my headphones. Looks great on my desk and does the job, but taking a star off for price.
customer_reviews.author: n2padres

customer_reviews.title: Not for this price, but it’s an ok thing
customer_reviews.text: Even though I’m a lil’ disappointed with it being just a piece of metal (I thought something on it gonna be connected for it to shine or something), it’s an ok stand. Not for this price IMHO, but oh well
customer_reviews.author: lovi_moment

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and high quality. Classy for showing off your setup
customer_reviews.text: This stand is brilliant for showing off your sing setup. Looks a class apart.
customer_reviews.author: Joshie

customer_reviews.title: Its great
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, looks good, works well, and mix's your audio.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

product_meta.title: Corsair ST100 RGB Premium Headset Stand with 7.1 Surround Sound - 3.5mm and 2xUSB 3.0
product_meta.description: Style:RGB StandProudly display your headset with the ST100 RGB premium headset Stand featuring premium aluminum construction and customizable RGB lighting Built-in 3 5mm analog input enables full range Stereo or 7 1 surround sound for an immersive multi-channel audio experience Cue software controls RGB lighting and audio settings and syncs with other Corsair RGB devices via an intuitive and simple to use interface Easy access dual USB 3 1 inputs provide improved charging power and faster data speeds for your headset phone and other devices while the non-slip rubberized base provides stability and protection for your desk
feature_bullets: Durable aluminum construction and iconic design, combine to create the ultimate display for your headset
Dynamic RGB lighting across 9 zones allows for virtually unlimited color options
Built-in 3.5mm analog input enables full range Stereo or 7.1 Surround sound for an immersive, multi-channel Audio experience
Easy access, Dual USB 3.1 inputs provide improved charging power and faster data speeds for your headset, phone and other devices
Non-slip, rubberized base provides stability and protection for your headset

CORSAIR iCUE software enables custom audio equalizer settings, immersive 7.1 surround sound, sidetone control and RGB lighting synchronization with compatible CORSAIR peripherals, coolers, fans and more
Works great with all iCUE compatible hardware

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,464 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
